ref: Jour: Nuclear Physics, Section A, Vol.616, p.131 (1997)
title: Measurement of the angular distribution for the 7Be(d,n)8B reaction and determination of the astrophysical S factor for the 7Be(p,g)8B reaction

x4freetext: Measurement of the angular distribution for the
7Be(d,n)8B reaction and determination of the
astrophysical S factor for the 7Be(p,g)8B reaction

x4codes.hlp: China Inst. of Atomic Energy, Beijing, China, People`s Rep.

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Nuclear Physics, Section A, Vol.616, p.131 (1997)

x4codes.hlp: China Inst. of Atomic Energy, Beijing, China, People`s Rep.

x4freetext: HI -13 tandem accelerator
The 7Be beam with an energy of 20.0 MeV was
produced via the 1H(7Li,7Be)n reaction by bombarding
a H2 gas cell at 1.2 atm pressure with a 34 MeV 7Li
ions from HI-13 tandem accelerator. The beam
typically comprises more than 90% 7Be(4+) ions with
the major contaminants 7Be(3+)(<2%,12MeV) and
7Li(3+) ions (<9%,13MeV)
9 cm long ionization chamber filled with 75Torr
P-10 gas backed by a 45x45mm2 Hamamatsu two-dimensional
position sensitive silicon detector (PSSD) of 450 mu-m
in thickness.
A deuterated polyethylene (CD2)n) foil of 0.97 mg/cm2
in thickness was used as the secondary target and a
polyethylene ((CH2)n) foil was used to determine the
background.
Entry was deleted. Duplication of F0745.
